data.description:
Music Time is a watch face that lets you enjoy your Music even when you aren't listening to it. The watchface colors adapt to the album art of the songs you're listening to and will even display the current album art and Pebble Health statistics for users who have upgraded to premium (via the companion app).

Premium users can also enjoy watch face customizations;
-Choose what and when information is displayed on 4 independent information layers.
-Choose to display Time, Date, Steps, Active Time, Sleep and Distance Traveled (Km or Mi).

Not listening to music for a while? No problem! Music Time will continue to let you enjoy the art from the last song you listened to.

http://itsmusicti.me

data.description: CO2 reports the concentration of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere, as measured by the U.S. NOAA's Manua Loa Observatory ( http://www.esrl.noaa.gov/gmd/ccgg/trends/weekly.html ). The main value is the previous week's average, and it is compared to the weekly average taken 1 year ago and 10 years ago. This watchface uses the API developed by HQCasanova ( http://www.hqcasanova.com/en/projects/co2.php ).

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: Time telling dots!
Readability: medium
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

I was sketching for a stylish way to transform the classic 7-segment numbers. One day I thought about how these numbers would look, if seen through a perforated metal plate. Its holes would have a different visual density depending on how much lines meet underneath. This is where the idea for Digital Density was born.

The numbers are made of six dots at maximum. The dots are where the segments of the classic numbers have their ends. Sometimes three classic number segments meet in a spot, the visual density is high there. This situation has been transformed to a big dot for the new numbers. If two classic number segments would meet, the density is medium and so the resulting dot is medium. A single line results in a small dot. No line - no dot at all. So the new dot numbers have the same visual density as the classic numbers but have a more abstract appearance. They look weird at first, but they share a certain resemblance with their archetypes. There are four numbers aligned in a 2x2 array. The top ones tell the hours, the bottom ones tell the minutes. The Pebble Time fits nicely to these numbers with its round and simple case.

The red watchface has been made especially for the red Pebble Time. 

Design : Sam Jerichow Programming : Sam Jerichow with kind support from Nev Rawlins
Copyright © 2012, 2015 Sam Jerichow
data.title: Digital Density R

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: Diagonal lines from the future.
Readability: easy
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

Harigane means wire in japanese. This watchface is inspired by circuitry. The "wires" run diagonally across the display and perform a sharp bend whenever they would pass a number. The actual numbers are invisible so you can only see them indirectly. Harigane has a stylish value for those who like lines, 45° hatches and circuits.

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2015 Sam Jerichow

Thanks to Nev Rawlins for his support!
data.title: Harigane Y

data.title: Trisms

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: Very low resolution numbers
Readability: medium
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

I like pixels so I developped a display, that shows time with low resolution numbers.

Imagine the classic 7-segment numbers you know from LCD displays. In this watchface, they are pixelated to the max, until they are almost unrecognizeable. Almost. The result is a set of numbers made of 2x3 pixels which are still distinguishable by the position and the brightness of their pixels. The rule is: the more lines are in that area, the stronger the pixel. 

Low resolution doesn't mean low quality. There are pixels everywhere these days. It's a cool artistic way to describe reality.

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2012, 2015 Sam Jerichow 

Thanks to Nev Rawlins for his support!
data.title: Pixel Intensity M

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: Color bars instead of numbers.
Readability: hard
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

Spectrum is a fun watchface with a scientific background. It started as binary idea. 1 = white and 0 = black. Once I had the basic shades for the basic numbers I thought, it would be interesting to give all the other numbers parts of the color spectrum. The cool thing is, the color spectrum can be divided into 8 distinguishable colors indeed! I'm using four long bars to tell the time. This is inspired by emission spectra of elements that get passed by light. The width of the bars increases by the usage of that digit. 

So basically, each number is a color. Sounds simple, but how do you learn which color belongs to which number? Make up a story. Red is love of two people. Orange three sounds like orange tree etc. The sillier the story, the easier to memorize. After a while you can read the watch faster while others just see wrist decoration.

Check out the color reference chart in the preview section and... good luck!

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2012, 2015 Sam Jerichow

I thank Nev Rawlins for his support!
data.title: Spectrum

data.description:
A digital watchface where the numbers are arranged one inside the other in a Russian doll style, with each number an hour glass shape to avoid cross-overs.    

The time is read from the outside. The two outer digits are the hours and the smaller inner two are the minutes. 
The digits are different colors to make it easier to read: 10-hours in green, single hours in yellow, 10-minutes in red and single minutes in blue. 

The simple cryptic display should appeal to people who like things that are a bit different, but is still recognisable to the more conservative.

Time will display in 12-hour or 24-hour mode, depending on the watch setting.

Screenshots show:  
 (1) 08:52
 (2) 09:36
 (3) 23:57 (24-hour mode)
 (4) 10:15 (with Quck View) 

Design created by Peter Fletcher and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio.   It is published with the designers’ permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.   

The original design can be found here:  
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2012/07/21/digit-stacked-mkiii-an-led-watch-from-the-3rd-dimension/

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble 2 and Quick Views

data.title: Digit

data.description:
A simple analog clock inspired by a radar screen, now with color! Weather data loaded from Openweathermap at 1 hour intervals. Icons from TimeStyle by freakified, many thanks. 

Info: 
- battery level at top left 
- steps or distance walked at top right
- sunrise or humidity at bottom left 
- sunset or wind speed at bottom right 
- weather at 6 o'clock position 
- current location and latest update time under 12 o'clock dial

Choose these configuration settings: 
- white or black background
- Celsius or Fahrenheit temperatures 
- sunrise/sunset times or humidity/windspeed
- steps walked or distance walked in meters
- use GPS location or manually set location using city name or OpenWeatherMap ID
- am/pm or 24 hour times 
- show/hide seconds 
- vibrate at the start of each hour

latest_release.release_notes:
New icons
Added Health API support, shows no. of steps walked or distance walked in meters
New clean design

Fix a cryptic error that prevented loading onto original pebbles, but only via the app store.
Added support for black and white Pebbles.

It can be the name of someone or something, even your Amateur Radio (Ham) call! It's YOUR watchface. A Bluetooth indicator (and vibration when connectivity is lost optionally set in the config page) as well as battery percentage and a battery percentage bar (showing green for OK, Red for 20% or less, and blue for charging) are included.

data.author: dP-watchfaces
data.description:
PC - Pebble Computer 

The timeboard, the keytime, I mean the keyboard, is not a QWERTY exactly... Each key has information!

- Display is off when the Pebble is disconnected from phone.

- Setting: Weather temperature units (C, F, K) 
- Setting: Vibes on phone disconnect 
- Setting: Day/month order
- Setting: Multiple color themes (Pebble Time only)

- Abbreviation for the day of the week (automatic in spanish or english)
- Abbreviation for the month of the year (automatic in spanish or english)

- Abbreviation for the weather condition (automatic in spanish or english):
*In english: GET (getting info), SUN (Sunny), CLR (Clear), PCL (Partly cloudy), CLD (Clouds), RAI (Rain), THN (Thunderstorm), SNW (Snow), FOG (fog).
*In spanish: LOC (localizando), SOL (Soleado), CLR (Claro), PAR (Parcialmente nublado), NUB (Nublado), LLU (Lluvia), TOR (Tormenta eléctrica), NVE (Nieve) y NBL (Niebla).

- Abbreviation for the bluetooth status (BC: connected, BD: disconnected)
- Abbreviation for battery charged level (LO: Low, FU: Full, 30-90%)
data.title: PC

V1.0: Does nothing more than showing the hour, but with some basic visual customizations for both Aplite and Basalt systems.

data.description:
A minimalistic analog watchface that will show only the actual hour and the minute hand.

It can be fully customized, the options include:
· Bluetooth status, it can be shown with an icon or by changing the color of some element.
· Battery, shown with a percentage (it can be hidden unless it goes under some level) or by changing the color of some element.
· All elements of the watchface can be customized with any of the 64 colors of Pebble Time.
· Fully modifiable date format and position.
· Seconds and exact minute positions can be shown.
· Shake your wrist to show some of the information (you can choose what and for how long).

This idea comes from a post in Reddit by the user joeytitans, where he posted an image of a real wallclock with a rotating disc that only shows the current hour.

Special thanks to Reddit users PiwwowPants and Limp1 that helped me test on real devices and sent pictures of it.

latest_release.release_notes: Date, seconds, exact minute positions, tap gesture, more color options.

data.title: HourWindow

data.description:
This is a clock like a Japanese pedestrian signal.
You can recognize the "mm" of "YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss".
When the color is red, it is even number minutes now.
When the color is green, it is odd number minutes now.
Enjoy!

What?
Do you want to know a more correct time?

No problem.
This app has configuration items to display more information. You can change the configuration to display now minutes and now seconds.

Hour? Day? Month?
You know vaguely it, don't you?


OK.

This app offers the method that you glance the correct time  too. Please twist your wrist quickly :)

This is first release.
I am planning to append some display pattern.
Please tell me what kind of pattern you want.

I received my Pebble Time Steel in mid September, and finally got to try out my own app :)

data.description:
Universal Watchface: 
- same design and functionality on Pebble, Pebble Steel & Pebble Time
- special mixed-color background (only Pebble Time)
- analogue and digital clock
- battery status
- bluetooth status
- mini calendar
- month/day 
- moonface
- sunrise/sunset (before and afternoon respectively)
- weather:
  * temperature
  * icon & text
  * humidity %
  * wind speed & direction
  * air pressure current (last 2 digits) hPa and graph

Currently not customizable, short month names in Hungarian only :-)

*** EASTER EGG *** :-)

data.author: DocF87

changelog.release_notes:
new:
- all colors are configurable
- alternative font faces to choose
- more display options to choose for displaying battery state and date
- indicator when battery is loading
- option for vibration on full hour
- if phone is without internet connection old data is displayed (a dot under the watch indicates that old weather data is displayed)

fixes/optimizations:
- weather update should be more reliable
- weather icons smaller
- various other fixes
- adding option to show battery level as number instead of image

data.description:
Classic watchface for Pebble Time offering additional information (complications):
- battery indicator of the watch battery
- date
- current temperature
- current weather condition

Settings:
- all colors
- font
- seconds hand visible/hide/hide at defined time
- weather information via autolocation or for fixed location
- interval of weather updates
- vibrate on bluetooth disconnect
- vibrate on full hour
- display options for date and battery

The dot under the watch dial indicates, that the last weather update was unsuccessful due to missing internet connection on your phone. Old weather information is displayed but updated at next update-interval (or earlier if you switch to the timeline or menu). The dot will vanish if updated weather information is displayed again.

Weather information provided by Yahoo Weather.
Please note that displaying the seconds handle reduces battery life because the screen has to update every second.
data.title: Analog

data.author: chops
data.description:
Another variation of a common theme..  most of my time here was spent  creating each of the icons.  I hope you like them.

It displays weather for the day (large font), with the current max (upper) and min (lower) temperatures.

Data from Yahoo, updated half-hourly.  Turn the seconds on/off via settings.

The numbers centre/bottom show your current battery level.

Also available, for PTR users only, is "Big Geometric weather".  I haven't done this for the other Pebble watches as the design does not translate very well.

Watchface will invert and vibrate if connection to the phone is lost.

Now supports - Czech.

This watchface provides time (including seconds), date and day of the week in digital form. And also namedays for current and next day. If namedays is public holiday, it's rendered as bold. Only for czech users. Time informations are updated every second. Other data every day.
NEWS! There is actual weather for current location.

Czech

Watchface zobrazuje datum a čas (včetně sekund) v digitální podobě. Též ukazuje den v týdnu včetně svátků pro aktuální a následující den. Státní svátky jsou zobrazovány tučně. Podporována je pouze čeština. Čas je aktualizován každou sekundu, ostatní informace jednou denně.
NOVĚ je k dispozici počasí pro aktuální umístění.

data.author: Oliver Merkel

changelog.release_notes: Mind that display is valid for northern hemisphere only. Support for southern hemisphere on request if higher demand is indicated by some users.

data.description: Decelerate your day with a less stressful time display. Exact time is shown by analog hour hand only. Additional feature is the display of the current Moon phase. The watchface shows a single hour hand only. Midnight is on bottom of the clockface while Noon is indicated on top. One rotation of the hour hand takes a whole day. An indicator for the seconds is blinking on bottom of the watchface. If holding the Pebble watch parallel over ground and turning it so the hour hand is pointing towards the sun then top of the watch face will always point in south direction and bottom of watch face in north direction on northern hemisphere (Compass feature). Additionally the current Moon phase is shown with more convenience for observers of northern hemisphere. Moon phase display is expected to work until end of Unix Time (overflow on Jan 19th, 2038 03:14:07 GMT) at least as implemented here.

latest_release.release_notes: Mind that display is valid for northern hemisphere only. Support for southern hemisphere on request if higher demand is indicated by some users.

data.title: Decelerate - Northern Hemisphere

data.author: MicroByte

changelog.release_notes:
Pebill has moved to somewhere with less Earthquakes.  

(New Pebill actions coming soon!)
Format time based on your time preference, sorry about that!

More bug's were crushed, sprayed and trapped.
Also added a mysterious late night visitor to the mix.

Ooops! PEBILL's house apparently had a few bugs running around in it. This release should address some of those issues. 

PEBILL says thanks for all the love so far!

+ Some users were having trouble reading the time.  Since this is a watchface, time is important to be able to read.  We made it readable.  
+ Also removed the PEBILL Logo since that caused rage.

+ New Future States 
+ Shaken but not stirred?

data.description:
tl;dr -  Think of him as a virtual Sea Monkey, but just don't call him that!

Meet PEBILL!  PEBILL might be the first virtual buddy on a watch, but for legal reasons, we're really not 100% sure of that.  

What we do know is that PEBILL lives his day to day virtual life doing what a virtual person might do if he were real, even celebrating special weekdays and holidays throughout the year!   This is what we imagined a virtual person might do, but we're probably wrong, it was worth a shot.

PEBILL works, plays and lives in his virtual world for you to watch and enjoy, which is pretty creepy when you think about it.  

PEBILL doesn't ask for much, only that you feed him every couple of days if you can remember.  Don't worry though, he'll remind you when you forget!

So how much would you pay for a virtual buddy that goes wherever your Pebble goes? How about nothing, that seems fair to us. 

Be sure to share the love by hitting the heart above...  or else PEBILL will have to cry himself to sleep at night.

PEBILL is compatible with the Original Pebble, Pebble Steel and Pebble Time.
data.title: PEBILL

The majority of re-coding courtesy Balázs Baranyai - better yahoo weather handling (reduced API calls) - weather can be disabled and will turn itself off after 4 hours if there is no change - although it still refreshes every half hour.

For pebble time, choose from a few background colour schemes, have time text orange/white, show daily steps, and more.

Languages supported include,

If you want to customize / change settings, use the source code from github

Day of week, month, day of month, seconds, sunrise, sunset, weather, degrees Celsius, wind speed in km/h, atmospheric pressure in mmHg, humidity, minutes since last update.

data.author: Noah Hanover
data.description: This app shows you the time with beautiful animations and a breathtaking starry night. How could you not wonder what is the beyond without looking at this watchface?
data.title: The Corcle Face

data.author: Loic Verrall
data.description:
Time is a simple, modern watch face based on the Simplicity watch face. 
Features include: 
- Current weather (updated every 30 minutes). Please see my other watch faces for a Celsius version. 
- Day of the week. 
- Date and Month of the year (American format - E.g. May 19). Please see my other watch faces for a UK format version (E.g. 19 May).
- A Seconds line which grows each second and wraps round at 60. It indicates how many seconds you are into each minute. E.g. if its half way filled, you're 30 seconds into the minute. 
- Time (12h or 24h). 
- A battery indicator at the bottom of the screen similar to that of the seconds line. A half filled bar represents 50% battery.  

I hope you enjoy the watch face. If you have any comments/suggestions, feel free to email me: support@loicverrall.co.uk
data.title: Time (Fahrenheit)

data.author: Darkenvy

changelog.release_notes: Added last card to memory. Shows last card on boot to disillusion loading. Shortened change interval from 60 minutes to 10 minutes.
Fixed settings to not require API every time. Simply change settings on the fly. Added 3 modes to display under settings.

data.description:
NOTE: Must install this Japanese language pack to work! Japanese is not natively supported by Pebble. http://wh.to/pebble/index_jp.html

WaniKani  on your Pebble watch! Immerse yourself not only with the time, but your most difficult words. This app takes a snapshot of your WaniKani profile every hour to provide you with the most  to date vocabulary throughout your . Currently grabs any words under 70% [correct] rating. If your difficult words aren't for you, you can also change it to display recent unlocks or no words at all. Due to popular demand, activity mode is now available; showing only your due queue on WaniKani. See the last snapshot for example.

Tells the time,
Shows your title & Level
Shows Kanji, Hiragana and the definition
Informs you of your current review count available
Updates hourly & changes words upon every change to the screen.
Runs on Javascript


Notes:  If you like the Japanese language pack, show your support to the developer. He performed much more work than I did and without his effort, this watch-face would not have come to fruition.  

The javascript which this is written in runs on your phone. The delay function only works if the app is in the foreground for the entire hour. Working on finding a better solution. For the time being, toggling away and back to the watch-face will update it manually.

latest_release.release_notes: Added last card to memory. Shows last card on boot to disillusion loading. Shortened change interval from 60 minutes to 10 minutes.

data.title: WaniKani TokeiTokei Legacy

data.title: PEB 9000

data.author: Bhakterija
data.description:
"If you want to catch a train - look at your watch. If you want to know the best time to work, rest and eat - look at the sun."

This watchface is intended to help you align your daily actitvities and circadian rhythm with natural solar cycle.

What it does:
1) uses your phones location services to retrieve your current location,
2) calculates sunrise, sunset and local true solar time for your location,
3) displays both Solar time (in the upper part) and Clock time (in the lower part),
4) displays position of the Sun as a watch hand,
5) displays duration of night and day as a black and white background (in solar time scale), also astronomical, civil and nautical twilight.
6) displays your local sunrise and sunset time (in clock time).

It automatically tries to check your location and recalculate sun data every 30 minutes. If location services are not available, it uses last known location.

If you find it useful, please consider dropping a bit or two to bitcoin:18QcovzwPmxiEp4Vr9CQCd4MNstugi8ZGu. Thanks!
data.title: Solar watch

data.author: Johtull
data.description: Basic binary clock. Top row = hours in base 2, bottom row = minutes in base 2. Empty boxes are zeros, filled boxes are ones. 24-hour format. Colors invert between 6pm and 6am.
data.title: Simple Binary Clock

data.description: This watchface shows the time, date, battery percent, and shows the moon and sun rise/set. It changes based on the time of day, and every 6 hours, it sets again. data.description:
L7

Numbers are arranged around a rectangle and connected by two right-angled lines. Reading the time is easy: the thin (red) line connects the hour digits, and the thicker (blue) connects the minute digits. Time is consequently read clockwise around the face, starting at the top. 

The name? L7 as in ‘square’.

This will appeal to those who appreciate a geometric display that is somewhat cryptic, yet actually very easy to read. 

Time will display in 12-hour or 24-hour mode, depending on the watch setting.

There is a configuration option to fill the areas rather than just have lines (following a user request) - see screenshot 5.


Screenshots:  
 (1)   6:25 
 (2) 12:36
 (3)   4:35
 (4) 17:17 (in 24-hour mode) 
 (5)   8:17 (filled)


Design from the Tokyoflash Design Studio, created by Anders Svedell.   The watchface has been published with the designer's permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.   

The original design can be found here:  
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2011/01/14/l7-square-geometric-concept-watch/

To see other sanctioned Tokyoflash watchfaces, click on "More from this Developer".

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble 2 and Quick Views.
